Articles.Content:
With the help of ThomasP, lead dev for Kopernicus, I would like to announce the long awaited Sentar Expansion.

We have recreated the original 9 planets from Krag's PlanetFactory. This is an early release as I do not consider it done and it still needs a lot of work, but I think it's ready to be play tested and seems stable enough. Many hours of work have gone into getting this where it is now and I hope someone can enjoy the end results.

> 
> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/HyKvM)

REQUIRES KOPERNICUS 

**Download**

- **Sentar Expansion**

**Known Issues**

No stars are added as I find them still to be buggy with Kopernicus

Ablate scaledspace doesn't exactly line up with PQS view. This is hard to get right due to limitations in the way flatten works

Probably lots of other small things

**Future Goals**

Add resources

Need to add science to all Planets

Need to add biomes to all Planets

**License is GPL**

**Edited <time datetime="2021-05-04T15:41:11Z" title="05/04/2021 03:41  PM" data-short="3 yr">May 4, 2021</time> by Snark**
  
Link to defunct website removed by moderator

I literally closed my KSP when I saw this.

Downloading now!

What does Joker currently orbit?

Also any plans for DDS conversion? Comet tail for Ascension? Krag's approval ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-25T20:02:25Z" title="07/25/2015 08:02  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 25, 2015</time> by \_Augustus\_**

> 
> I literally closed my KSP when I saw this.
> Downloading now!
> 
> What does Joker currently orbit?
> 
> Also any plans for DDS conversion? Comet tail for Ascension? Krag's approval ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)?

I put Joker in a retro-grade orbit around the sun for the time being. I plan to move it to a moon of one of the other planets once I get them added in. As for DDS yea that's probably in the works. Comet tail is a no. I wanted to keep them as close as possible to the originals which is why I kept the ridiculous rotation of Inaccessible. That may need to be tweaked down slightly if no one finds it possible to actually land on it.
already said so, but congrats! they are beautiful! ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> I put Joker in a retro-grade orbit around the sun for the time being. I plan to move it to a moon of one of the other planets once I get them added in. As for DDS yea that's probably in the works. Comet tail is a no. I wanted to keep them as close as possible to the originals which is why I kept the ridiculous rotation of Inaccessible. That may need to be tweaked down slightly if no one finds it possible to actually land on it.

If the rotation is the same as Krag's original Inaccessible, then landing is completely possible, but only at the poles. Or if you have KAS installed.

> 
> I put Joker in a retro-grade orbit around the sun for the time being. I plan to move it to a moon of one of the other planets once I get them added in. As for DDS yea that's probably in the works. Comet tail is a no. I wanted to keep them as close as possible to the originals which is why I kept the ridiculous rotation of Inaccessible. That may need to be tweaked down slightly if no one finds it possible to actually land on it.

 I would try to expand the star systems if I were you, I felt like they didn't have enough to be worth visiting. Inaccessable can totally be landed on, Scott Manley did it!
EDIT: Also is that a green atmo on Skelton?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-25T20:32:16Z" title="07/25/2015 08:32  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 25, 2015</time> by \_Augustus\_**
Yes it is, it's what Skelton had.
Okay, I already have a bug report! Inaccessable makes you unable to non-physwarp while orbiting it.
Yea I need to tweak the time warp limits of some planets I think

Okay, a really weird glitch...

It seems as if that when you time warp on Inaccessable, the planets drift off their orbits. When you stop time-warping, they slowly drift back! Nvm they don't drift back.

I've seen that issue before but not sure what causes it. It doesn't just happen with this mod though, other planet packs have had it happen as well. Also I think I know what the cause of no time warping on Inaccessible so maybe I can fix that later. Also I notice some scaled space issues not lining up correctly \*sigh\*

OMG I LOVE YOU! Thank you for putting this back into the game!

Will give rep.

If you have any questions ask me or my buddies.

I've missed this pack for too long, now the only thing that's truly left is to fix the Urania pack for Kopernicus...

![xBCEIAw.png](http://i.imgur.com/xBCEIAw.png)

HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!

Erin has really fun bugs.

Here are the ones shown in the picture:

1. Things can't fly on Erin, they act like they are flying on Jool or Eve.

2. Spaceplanes roll into water if you physwarp

3. Nothing floats in the oceans for some reason.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-25T20:44:51Z" title="07/25/2015 08:44  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 25, 2015</time> by \_Augustus\_**
Inaccessible... fond memories of this little place. Kudos, man. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Wasn't aware of the issues on Erin. Will have to add them to the TODO list which is seemingly getting bigger and bigger ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> Wasn't aware of the issues on Erin. Will have to add them to the TODO list which is seemingly getting bigger and bigger ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

 The non-floating issue happens on all Kopernicus ocean worlds as far as I know.

Ok I think I fixed the issues with time warp and scaled space not matching up for inaccessible. I'm going to wait to put out a fix for now as I'm pretty tired and been working on this pretty much all day and I want to fix a few more things before I update. Probably be tomorrow

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> The non-floating issue happens on all Kopernicus ocean worlds as far as I know.

I tested on Erin and I got normal water but my altitude was 0. I guess I will need to go look at more spots in Erin to see if there are any spots of water above 0 altitude.

Gosh, I almost didn't see this thread. Nice job Borisbee! After all this time, the Krag's classic is still one of my personal favorite, so thanks for remaking it to Kopernicus. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) Guess I will do a little bit of nostalgia flight. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Very, very interesting. Subscribed!
I always found Joker a little ridiculous in that it's orbit was so close to Serious/Kerbol. You should move it to be a Pluto analog.

> 
> Gosh, I almost didn't see this thread. Nice job Borisbee! After all this time, the Krag's classic is still one of my personal favorite, so thanks for remaking it to Kopernicus. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) Guess I will do a little bit of nostalgia flight. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Thanks! Yea I always enjoyed Krag's planets because they seemed to fit in so well with the stock planets and when it comes to planets I prefer them to be stock alike. Ablate and Erin have given me the most trouble. Ablate due to it's scaled space issues, and Erin because it's hard to get the terrain correct.

> 
> Thanks! Yea I always enjoyed Krag's planets because they seemed to fit in so well with the stock planets and when it comes to planets I prefer them to be stock alike. Ablate and Erin have given me the most trouble. Ablate due to it's scaled space issues, and Erin because it's hard to get the terrain correct.

 Ablate has always had scaledspace issues, since the original PF.

Working on Erin today, got the terrain fixed so that it no longer uses a VertexColorMap. Preview pic of the new scaledspace below

![lOVZDw1.png](http://i.imgur.com/lOVZDw1.png)

This should match the terrain exactly so no weird terrain differences as you fade in to the PQS view.

> 
> Working on Erin today, got the terrain fixed so that it no longer uses a VertexColorMap. Preview pic of the new scaledspace below
> [http://i.imgur.com/lOVZDw1.png](http://i.imgur.com/lOVZDw1.png)
> 
> This should match the terrain exactly so no weird terrain differences as you fade in to the PQS view.

 It looks... Shiny!

![3GTfhb8.png](http://i.imgur.com/3GTfhb8.png)

I didn't like how bumpy it was, so I changed it so look more like the original.
